com.yantra.ycp.ui.io

Class YCPToledoPSImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.yantra.ycp.ui.io.YCPToledoPSImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    YCPWeighingScaleConnector

    public class YCPToledoPSImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements YCPWeighingScaleConnector
    This class implements YCPWeighingScaleConnector interface for Mettler Toledo PS series models. Currently it handles the following models and configurations: 
     Models supported:
    PS15, PS30, PS60, PS6L, PS2+

 Configurations supported:
    Any configuration which returns data in pure numeric format such as xxx.xx,
    xxx.xxx, xxxx, etc.

    Note: This implementation does not support XXXlbXX.Xoz formats in lb-oz builds.
    This implementation is initialzed by the YCPWeighingFactory. See init for details.

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public void init(com.yantra.yfc.dom.YFCElement configElement)
        This method initializes the class. This is called by the YCPWeighingFactory using the following configuration XML:
        <PRE> <Config ClassName="" PortId="" BaudRate="" DataBits="" StopBits="" Parity="" FlowIn="" FlowOut="" HighResolutionData=""/> </PRE>
        In the above XML, all attributes except HighResolutionData are standard serial port parameters. If HighResolutionData is set to "Y" then this program issues a "H" command instead of "W". High resolution data supports upto 3/4 decimal digits depending on the model where as low resolution data is only 2 digits after the decimal.
        Specified by:
        init in interface YCPWeighingScaleConnector
        Parameters:
        configElement - DOM which contains the configuration parameters

      • getWeight

        public double getWeight()
        Main method to obtain weight from the scale. This method opens the serial port connection, sends a reset command to scale (if resetRequired is "Y" in config XML), sends the get weight command (either "W" or "H" depending on value of HighResolutionData attribue in config XML), and returns weight to the calling program. It throws exception if weighing scale does not return expected result.
        Specified by:
        getWeight in interface YCPWeighingScaleConnector
        Returns:
        Weight from the scale

      • resetScale

        public void resetScale()
        Resets the Weighing Scale by issuing "Z" command and checks for response. If the response shows error, it throws appropriate exception.
        Specified by:
        resetScale in interface YCPWeighingScaleConnector
